title: Fishy001
author: Fishy001
created_time: October 02, 2022, 09:02:32 AMLast edit: October 02, 2022, 10:24:35 AM by Fishy001
content: Scammers Profile Link: Scammed amount - 500 usdProfile :https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=307265here proof of these scammers from their sitehttps://www.loom.com/share/58a4a533699943d39142a17247a95ed4What happened:Yesterday is as my first day with Bitstarz I ask if I could use VPN they said yes. I deposited 500 usd and lost in in few minutes in their original Blackjack.Later I deposited 1000 usd and won 540 USD in dice.Ended up with 1540 USDS and make withdraw and had the longed withdraw 2 hours waiting no thing. Contact agent they told me to that I play from prohibited country.I say no - I am from isrel but I am from colombia he said send proofs.I sent them what they ask - Hotel invoice, selfie on the hotel and passportAfter they allow me iwthdraw only my 1000$ deposit without my winning.The guy himself told me that I can use VPN and play as a tourist in a country where is alloed!! Israel is prohibited colombia is not. They are scammers take your winnings under shady terms but if you lose they dont give a refund Here profile to write them bad reviews:https://www.trustpilot.com/review/bitstarz.comReport to their domain name: https://support.namecheap.com/index.php?/Tickets/Submit/RenderFormNon a note side: I recommend casinos like Duelbits and Bc.game they aways paid me fast. Humble people in chat and good experience.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: I'm not even sure what to say here. This site has a history of shady business practices and scam accusations. Why did you choose to partner with a company that has such a bad reputation? There are plenty of reputable casinos out there. But while the world of online casinos is diverse, it's still important to do your homework. There are dozens of different factors to consider when choosing an online casino, from software, to security, to reputation. And you'll want to be sure that when you choose a casino, you're choosing a safe and secure environment for gambling.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Fishy001 on October 02, 2022, 09:02:32 AM-snip-Yesterday is as my first day with Bitstarz I ask if I could use VPN they said yes. If you are in Colombia, what are you using a VPN for?I watched yoiurvideo evidence carefully that you sent them the details as an israeli. Of course it's your fault they are looking for.Despite the support saying VPN is tolerated, it's not explicitly mentioned on the T&C page which then they can easily refute the claim that they ever allowed VPNs somewhere. In the end they will check your KYC.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Better not to use a gambling site that has no active threads again on this forum. I checked Bitstarzis official thread on the gambling board, it was last active in 2016. That was 6 years ago. Best to use those with active official thread on this forum. You can always check gambling board for that. Especially, those with active official account.Also supposing you checked Bitstarzis official thread on this forum, you would have later noticed the red flag and negative trust against the gambling site which is enough as a warning of not to use the gambling site to gamble.Quote from: ETFbitcoin on October 02, 2022, 09:41:25 AMCould you show any proof where they say VPN is allowed? Their ToS doesn't mention whether it's allowed or not allowed.I checked their ToS, there is nothing like VPN is allowed or not, but there are many countries that are not allowed to gamble on the site. I expect the site to block the IP of the countries if they do not want to be a scammer. Because of that, some people may use VPN.It is not good to use VPN on gambling a site, it brings suspicion and can lead to the gambling site to scam even people from the countries that are allowed. That does not mean Bitstarzis not a scam site though.

I doubt that they will your concern on this forum.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Every online casino will be suspicious when it comes to VPN, and I'm surprised that you don't know that, since it seems to me that you are not a beginner in online gambling. The fact that someone from their customer support told you otherwise does not mean anything, because the only thing that matters is what is written in the terms of service.I would say that you can consider yourself lucky that they allowed you to withdraw your deposit, which is really rare in these cases, and in addition, various checks can take weeks. Considering the reputation that casino has, I would be more concerned about the personal information you sent them, especially your passport.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Fishy001 on October 02, 2022, 02:58:53 PMthey allow vpns :  https://prnt.sc/GfOoHCb5CPRuI wrote to you that there is a difference between what a member of their customer support thinks, and what the system that detected your suspicious behavior thinks. Maybe now you should ask Emma why they didn't pay you your winnings - obviously players who play hidden behind a VPN have a different experience, which would mean that you can lose, but you are not allowed to win

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Fishy001 on October 02, 2022, 02:58:53 PMthey allow vpns : https://prnt.sc/GfOoHCb5CPRuYes, but this is the problem with using a VPN. You are only allowed to use a VPN if you are from a country that is not on the restricted list. Since you revealed with your KYC data that you are an Israeli citizen, they concluded that you used a VPN to bypass the country restriction and therefore violated the terms of service. Since you have already asked them if you can use their casino from Colombia, you did not need to mask your IP location with a VPN. I do not support the casino at all, since their reputation is bad anyway, but I am just saying that you would have a better case if your IP address matched your physical location.

comments.author: acroman08

Humble people in chat and good experience.despite my advertising one of the gambling sites you mentioned, If you haven't done it yet, I suggest reading the ToS or asking the gambling site's support you are currently playing at about their ToS to know if you are breaking any ToS. doing this could help avoid happening the same thing again. since, as far as I know, Duelbits also ask their gamblers for KYC if they detect something suspicious.
